name: West Cork Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is in such a picturesque setting. It's on the River Ilen. There is an old disused railway bridge beside the hotel that holds the beer garden/outdoor smoking area. I looked over the bridge on a sunny Sunday and could see loads of salmon swimming underneath. The hotel itself is lovely. The atmosphere is very relaxed. The rooms are old style, with lock and key. We had a comfortable bed and the decor was very nice. We attended a family wedding in the hotel. The meal was amazing. The staff couldn't be nicer. We had a wonderful breakfast on the morning of our departure. The lady in reception was incredibly friendly. She really was interested in us and asked us loads about where we were from etc. I am so impressed with the place that we are going to go back very very soon. Life's too short not to spend some quality time in beautiful West Cork ! This hotel is a gem.
reviews.title: Wonderful in every way

reviews.text: Great hotel that bent over backwards for us.
reviews.title: Couldn't of done more for us!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I organised my sisters Hen party and from the first call, I got a great response!!! On arrival all was sorted with great ease. Our room was lovely - very comfortable, renovated but still kept its old charm and with great rates. We got our own room for dinner which was fab, meal was so good and the service was superb - from everybody!! No problem was too much - they even went home to a house to get us a music player!!
reviews.title: Needs more renovations and better customer service - but the breakfast is great!

reviews.text: After a great night out in the town, just a short walk away but far enough not to be near the noise!! we got a great sleep in very comfortable beds and the highlight for some might be that the fab breakfast serves up until 12!!!
reviews.title: The Choir were delighted!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From reception, to waitress, duty manager, owner, breakfast staff and even passing accommodation staff - everybody was so nice and friendly and interested in our party!!!
reviews.title: lovely hotel at a great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent five nights in the West Cork Hotel at the beginning of September and from arrival to departure was a most enjoyable experience. On arrival we were warmly greeted and made feel very welcome.Room was spotless and very comfortable. Food was excellent with plenty of choices and the service was courtious and efficient. Staff are very welcoming and nothing is too much trouble to them. A most enjoyable experience and we would have no hesitation in recommending this gem of a hotel. We eill certainly be returning.
reviews.title: A most enjoyable experience with fantastic hoapitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the West Cork Hotel purely because we could bring our dog but luckily were very pleasantly surprised. Skibbereen is a lvely little town & a great base for the surrounding areas. The staff at the hotel were great and the room was lovely. Eventhough there was a wedding on the night of our stay we had no noise disturbace. Our dog was accommodated in the shed beside the hotel which was perfectly adequate. We'll definitely be back if we're in the area.
reviews.title: Great stay and we even brought our dog

reviews.text: Hotel is very deceiving hotel from the front, but once you enter the Reception it has a lovely classy modern feel. Lady on Front desk was lovely and very welcoming. Once you leave the lift on the 1st floor some rooms can be a bit of a maze to find. I had a lovely good sized room looking over the front of the hotel, but once I got there the thought did cross my mind as to what’s the most straight forward way to get back downstairs? But this is far from a complaint about the hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has held onto its traditional layout well while providing a very comfortable stay. The bathroom is narrow but they have worked well with the space and not as bad as some expressed.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.text: My stay was due to work reasons on this visit but it is definitely a Hotel I would come back to and stay for a lovely weekend in West Cork.
reviews.title: Shabby, badly laid out, frosty staff.

reviews.text: Good clean place, staff friendly and welcoming prices are fair, will return again
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed here ten years ago and not been impressed but on returning recently we loved it. The staff all very welcoming, the decor updated and the prices were lower than ten years ago. Alli in €59 euro for room with b&b for 2 and the breakfast was excellent. Very happy people.
reviews.title: Quiet and relaxing

reviews.text: This hotel is ideal with young children. Recently refurbished, this small town hotel has now a modern feel in the lounge, a good bar (with sofas- great for smallies!), lovely restaurant (huge portions though), very friendly staff from reception to restaurant. Breakfast is very well stacked for continental (fresh croissants, etc), and huge selection of cooked breakfast as well...you won't go hungry in this hotel! The best part for us was the room - best we've ever stayed in for our kids (4 and 1 years). Room 23 was a huge room with a partition wall in the middle, so one room had a huge double bed, cupboard, coffee facilities and TV for parents, and the other part of the room had a single bed, cot, another press and TV for the kids. This meant they could sleep while we could still read or watch TV after 8pm! Heaven for parents of young kids everywhere! Crisp white linen and fluffy towel, while it is not a very luxurious hotel, the right room IS a luxury for parents with small kids.. located right in town with lovery coffee places (Riverside Cafe), and Voyage Restaurant, both lovely food AND very child friendly (restaurant starts serving dinners at 5.30pm!). The only thing I would say is that on a Wedding week end, the hotel could probably get a bit noisy...but it is down to the guests, not the hotel. The whole week end felt very family friendly, from the hotel to the facilities in town (there is a playground as well in town).
reviews.title: Perfect with young children

reviews.text: A very picturesque hotel, beautiful lobby, castleesque with magnificent paintings.
reviews.title: Idylic on ilen street overlooking the tranqil ilen river!!

reviews.text: Very friendly and accomadating staff always smiling, which is a MUST when working in the service industry! Food was very tasty and full of choice, very good for vegetarians (as I am one) and had no qualms. Breakfast was also very good full of choice, wide range of hot to cold breakfasts. Excellent waitressing service.
reviews.title: Rough around the edges

reviews.text: I arrived into Skibbereen and could not find a guesthouse availible, so I called the hotel and after discussing my requirements I was given a Very good rate. My initial room was quite small but fine for a single person. After 2days elsewhere I checked back in and they remembered me and gave me my same rates and upgraded my room and it was a lot bigger. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fantastic, You could pretty much have everything and anything listed. When breakfast was busy I found I was overlooked for about 15min and other people sat nearer the staff were constantly being served before me, however after going and asking to be served everything was great.
reviews.title: Great Price, Great Location, Fantastic Breakfast

reviews.text: The Bar was a good place for a drink or to take in one of the daily meal specials.
reviews.title: Genuine welcome and high quality hospitality

reviews.text: The location was perfect, right in the centre of town so after exploring West Cork you could park up in the carpark and walk into town for a well deserved Guinness.
reviews.title: Just right!

reviews.text: I would stay here again
reviews.title: A gem by the Ilen!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent a couple of nights at the West Cork with my 13-year old daughter; I know the area very well having visited regularly over a period of many years, but this was my first stay at the hotel. After booking online I received a very friendly confirmation email, and when we arrived we were greeted with the same warmth and informality. We were a bit early for check-in, so were given an alternative room which was ready; it was clean and modern, very quiet, and had a limited but pretty view over the river and beyond. The bathroom was spotless - always a key factor in my assessment - and the bath and shower were both excellent. The room was a bit warm at night (the weather was unexpectedly mild after the long cold winter) but I turned the radiator off and opened the window slightly and we were quite comfortable.
reviews.title: Cork's best kept secret!!

description: Taking full advantage of the peaceful River Ilen views, The West Cork Hotel offers the best of both worlds – tranquility and location. Situated in the town centre, with all that Skibbereen & the surrounding area has to offer on our doorstep, the hotel is more than ideal for a complete break from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. 34 spacious, uniquely decorated guestrooms satisfy a variety of accommodation requirements, with many offering river views. The Ilen Bar is a place of relaxation, with luxurious leather seating and a delicious bar menu for a swift, casual snack. For those with more time to enjoy a leisurely bite – the Restaurant offers a carvery lunch by day, and full a la carte menu by night, featuring many of the local food producers on our menus.We are the ideal choice for those on business, those looking for an activity based holiday and those of you that just wish to kick back and relax!
